snp3.8:1.1: I can’t find any translation or note that captures this line properly. A _nimitta_ is a sign or portent, and is commonly used in the context of omens, prophecy, or fortune-telling. Here it means that there is no portent or omen by which one can predict the extent of life.
snp3.8:17.4: Commentary says this means, “I cannot bring back the dead” followed by Norman, Bodhi, and Thanissaro. But I think that reading is suspect. I think the text elides a second negative and should read: _na eso alabbhā_, lit. “This is not not-to-be-gotten by me”, i.e. “I cannot escape this”.
